info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crittenden to Norfolk International to 8 miles northeast of Princess Anne. Movement was northeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Virginia Wesleyan University, Old Dominion University, Ocean View, Norfolk, Portsmouth, Norfolk NAS, Ghent, and Norview around 545 PM EDT. Hampton around 550 PM EDT. Fort Monroe around 605 PM EDT. Hampton University around 610 PM EDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include Rudee Heights, Phoebus, Princess Anne Plaza, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Raleigh Terrace, Bayside, Oceana, Wards Corner, and North Virginia Beach.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ...THE CITY OF NORFOLK...THE NORTHERN CITY OF PORTSMOUTH...THE NORTHERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... THE CITY OF HAMPTON AND THE SOUTHERN CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS THROUGH 630 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Norfolk/Portsmouth; Virginia Beach; Newport News; Hampton/Poquoson
